alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Harrison; Nicholas (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:11AM EDT until July 28 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Bourbon County in central Kentucky... Eastern Harrison KY County in central Kentucky... Northwestern Nicholas County in central Kentucky... * Until 345 AM EDT. * At 111 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cynthiana, Millersburg, Venus, Colville, Buena Vista, Oddville, Morning Glory, Hooktown, Barefoot and Poindexter. This includes the following streams and drainages... Indian Creek, Stony Creek, Sycamore Creek, Laysons Branch, Silas Creek, Grays Run, Stoner Creek, Little Beaver Creek, Brushy Fork, Brushy Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
